com.oracle.tools.util
Class StopWatch

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.util.StopWatch

public class StopWatch
extends Object

A simple class that provides the functionality of a stop watch with millisecond accuracy (though this is based on the level of accuracy provided by the underlying operating system).

Copyright (c) 2008. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Constructor Summary
StopWatch()
          Constructs a StopWatch (in the not started state)
 
Method Summary
 long getElapsedTimeIn(TimeUnit units)
          Obtains the amount of elapsed time in the specified units for the StopWatch.
 void start()
          Starts the StopWatch.
 void stop()
          Stops the StopWatch so that the duration can be measured.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

StopWatch

public StopWatch()
Constructs a StopWatch (in the not started state)

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts the StopWatch. If the StopWatch was previously started and not stopped, the StopWatch is restarted at the current time.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the StopWatch so that the duration can be measured. If the StopWatch was not previously started, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the StopWatch was not previously started prior to this call

getElapsedTimeIn

public long getElapsedTimeIn(TimeUnit units)
Obtains the amount of elapsed time in the specified units for the StopWatch. If the StopWatch has been stopped, the stop time is used. If the StopWatch has not be stopped, the current time is used. If the StopWatch hasn't been started, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Parameters:
units - the TimeUnit for the elapsed time
Returns:
the number of units of the elapsed time since the StopWatch started
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the StopWatch was not previously started prior to this call
